job_title: Computer Service Technician in Hannibal, MO
pros: Staff was wonderful to work with
cons: There is nothing that I would say bad about this college

review_title: Wish I hadn't taken the job
pros: If you are retired (and aren't required by law to be insured) and don't have solid graduate training then you can get a job here.
cons: Think twice before taking a job here. The administration proudly renegotiated its debts convincing vendors to significantly discount their debts. They are known for unilaterally renegotiating contracts with faculty, which happened twice during my time here. The last time they did so they canceled insurance benefits, seized several months of overdue paychecks, and fired the best-qualified faculty to save revenue.

A general lack of integrity, which is ironic considering that it is owned and managed by a religious denomination (MO Southern Baptist convention). LOW academic standards. Worker morale is in the basement. Administrative personnel are the only ones who benefit. The president is getting rid of full time faculty in favor of adjuncts who don’t get benefits.
Everything is geared to the administration.
